cli.name: cis
cli.description: The cis namespace provides VMware common infrastructure namespaces

cli.name: task
cli.description: The task namespace provides enumerated types and classes used for managing tasks

cli.name: session
cli.description: The Session namespace allows API clients to manage session tokens including creating, deleting and obtaining information about sessions

cli.name: create
cli.description: Creates a session with the API

cli.name: delete
cli.description: Terminates the validity of a session token

cli.name: get
cli.description: Returns information about the current session

cli.name: tasks
cli.description: The Tasks namespace provides commands for managing the task related to a long running operation

cli.name: get
cli.description: Returns information about a task

options.description: Task identifier
If true, all data, including operation-specific data, will be returned, otherwise only the data described in Info will be returned
If true, the result will not be included in the task information, otherwise it will be included

cli.name: list
cli.description: Returns information about at most 1000 visible (subject to permission checks) tasks matching the Tasks.FilterSpec

options.description: Identifiers of tasks that can match the filter
Identifiers of services
Identifiers of operations
Status that a task must have to match the filter (see CommonInfo.status)
Identifiers of the targets the operation for the associated task created or was performed on (see CommonInfo.target)
Users who must have initiated the operation for the associated task to match the filter (see CommonInfo.user)
If true, all data, including operation-specific data, will be returned, otherwise only the data described in Info will be returned
If true, the result will not be included in the task information, otherwise it will be included

cli.name: cancel
cli.description: Cancel a running operation associated with the task

options.description: Task identifier

cli.name: install
cli.description: The service to install Embedded VCSA, PSC, Management VCSA, VMC gateway

cli.name: check-task
cli.description: Performs a precheck for the given specification

options.description: The location of the OVA file
The location of the OVF Tool
Flag to indicate whether or not to verify the SSL thumbprint of OVF Tool location
SSL thumbprint of OVF Tool location to be verified

The name of the Active Directory domain to which the management node or VMC Gateway should be joined (for example: example.com). *Warning:* This attribute is part of a new feature in development. It may be changed at any time and may not have all supported functionality implemented.

The username of the domain administrator in order to join the system to Active Directory. *Warning:* This attribute is part of a new feature in development. It may be changed at any time and may not have all supported functionality implemented.

The password of the domain administrator in order to join the system to Active Directory. *Warning:* This attribute is part of a new feature in development. It may be changed at any time and may not have all supported functionality implemented.

The organization unit to where the system should be added. *Warning:* This attribute is part of a new feature in development. It may be changed at any time and may not have all supported functionality implemented.

The name of the Active Directory domain to which the management node or VMC Gateway should be joined (for example: example.com). *Warning:* This attribute is part of a new feature in development. It may be changed at any time and may not have all supported functionality implemented.

The username of the domain administrator in order to join the system to Active Directory. *Warning:* This attribute is part of a new feature in development. It may be changed at any time and may not have all supported functionality implemented.

The password of the domain administrator in order to join the system to Active Directory. *Warning:* This attribute is part of a new feature in development. It may be changed at any time and may not have all supported functionality implemented.

The organization unit to where the system should be added. *Warning:* This attribute is part of a new feature in development. It may be changed at any time and may not have all supported functionality implemented.
The options control if a task should be skipped

cli.name: log
cli.description: The service that provides logs associated with a task of a given task ID

cli.name: get
cli.description: Retrieves the zipped files that contains operation log, serialized task flow, record of all configuration, and a current status of the operation

options.description: The ID of the operation

cli.name: migrate
cli.description: The service to migrate a windows VC to Embedded VCSA, PSC, and Management VCSA

cli.name: check-task
cli.description: Performs a precheck for the given specification

options.description: The name of the appliance to deploy
The type of appliance to deploy
A size descriptor based on the number of virtual machines which will be managed by the new vCenter appliance
The disk size of the new vCenter appliance
Password must conform to the following requirements: 1
Whether to deploy the appliance with thin mode virtual disks
The location of the OVA file
A flag to indicate whether the ssl verification is required
SSL thumbprint of ssl verification
The location of the OVF Tool
Flag to indicate whether or not to verify the SSL thumbprint of OVF Tool location
SSL thumbprint of OVF Tool location to be verified
The name of the Active Directory domain to which the source Windows installation is joined
Administrator user name of the Active Directory domain to which the source Windows installation is joined
Password for the active directory user
A flag to indicate whether the import of historical data should be deferred until after upgrade/migrate
The type of data to be upgraded/migrated
The OVF Tool arguments to be included

This key describes the enabling option for the VMware's Customer Experience Improvement Program (CEIP)

Single Sign-On administrator user on the source Windows vCenter server
The password of the Single Sign-On administrator on the source Windows vCenter server
The SSL thumbprint of Migration Assistant
Migration Assistant port number shown in the Migration Assistant console and log file
The IP address of the network adapter that will be migrated
Migration Assistant port number shown in the Migration Assistant console
Directory to export source configuration and data
The password of the vCenter Server service account

Administrator user password for the source Windows operating system

SSL thumbprint of the source appliance

The port of the source vum
Location of the installer of migration assistant to be uploaded to the source vSphere Update Manager

The SSL thumbprint of Migration Assistant
Migration Assistant port number shown in the Migration Assistant console and log file
The options control if a task should be skipped
